0.title: Toxic air pollution particles found in lungs, brains of unborn babies for the first time
0.article_body: Air pollution particles have been found in developing lungs and brains of unborn babies for the first time, a study by University of Aberdeen and Hasselt University in Belgium stated. Thousands of black carbon particles were found in each cubic millimetre of tissue, which were breathed in by mother during pregnancy and then passed through bloodstream and placenta to foetus.

1.title: 1.62 crore tourists visited J&K since January 2022, highest in 75 years: Govt
1.article_body: Around 1.62 crore tourists have visited Jammu and Kashmir since January 2022, the Union Territory government said on Thursday. The Directorate of Information and Public Relations (DIPR) of the J&K government said the tourist footfall in the Union Territory this year is the highest since India's independence, reported news agency ANI.

2.title: Waaree Energies raises ₹1,000 cr through investor funding
2.article_body: Solar panel manufacturing company Waaree Energies has raised ₹1,000 crore through investor funding. The firm withdrew its Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP) filed with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) last year, owing to the funding round. The company was founded in 1989 by Hitesh Mehta and it recently reported a turnover of ₹2,000 crore.

3.title: Stay away from WhatsApp, it's been a spying tool for 13 yrs: Telegram Founder
3.article_body: Messaging service Telegram's Founder and CEO Pavel Durov in a note on Telegram said, "You can use any messaging app you like, but do stay away from WhatsApp – it has now been a surveillance tool for 13 years." He added, "Every year we learn about some issue in WhatsApp that puts everything on their users' devices at risk."

4.title: Partha Chatterjee's custody extended till Oct 19 in WB SSC scam case
4.article_body: A special CBI court has extended the judicial custody of ex-West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee till October 19 in connection with the School Service Commission recruitment scam case. The court has also sent three other ex-officials, including ex-WBBSE president Kalyanmoy Ganguly, to judicial custody till October 19. All four accused will be produced before the court again on October 19.

5.title: Give ₹3,000 to common people for Diwali: Congress to Maha govt
5.article_body: Congress state chief Nana Patole has asked Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde to deposit ₹3,000 in the bank accounts of common people of the state for Diwali. "The people suffering from inflation should get relief!" he tweeted. In a letter to Shinde, Patole said the state government's Diwali package of ₹100 for ration card holders is "too small" for a family.

6.title: Haryana sends cough syrup samples to lab after WHO alert on Gambia deaths
6.article_body: Haryana has sent samples of four cough syrups manufactured by Sonipat-based Maiden Pharmaceuticals Limited to a Kolkata lab for testing after WHO potentially linked them to the death of 66 children in Gambia. "Action...will be taken once the [lab] report comes," Haryana's Health Minister Anil Vij said. Notably, the concerned syrups aren't sold in India.

7.title: Never going to happen: Big B's granddaughter Navya on becoming actress
7.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda, speaking about her plans to become an actress, said, "I think that dream is, unfortunately, going to be unfulfilled for many people." She said she keeps reminding people that she's an entrepreneur and that her becoming an actress is never going to happen. Navya's brother Agastya Nanda will make his debut in 'The Archies'.

8.title: 300 transgender artistes to be part of Sushmita's 'Taali': Report
8.article_body: Around 300 transgender artistes will reportedly be part of Sushmita Sen's upcoming web series 'Taali'. A source stated, "The show will require 25-50 trans artistes every day. A total of 300 transgender artistes have been hired for pivotal crowd scenes that will be shot over the next month." Sushmita will play transgender activist Gauri Sawant in the series.

9.title: 2 drug peddlers arrested, 156 gm heroin recovered in Meghalaya
9.article_body: The Meghalaya Police arrested two drug peddlers in East Khasi Hills district and over 156 grams of heroin was recovered from them, CM Conrad Sangma tweeted on Thursday. "Our war against drug trafficking is on!" he tweeted. The police also seized two smart phones, one vehicle and ₹1.28 lakh cash from the accused during the operation.

10.title: CM Eknath Shinde read BJP's script at Dussehra rally: Maha Cong chief
10.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole took a jibe at Eknath Shinde, saying that the CM is "BJP's puppet" who read its script during the Dussehra rally at the Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) ground on Wednesday. "We will not tolerate Shinde, his Ministers and MLAs repeatedly criticising the Congress to cover the sin of their rebellion," Patole said.

11.title: Porsche becomes Europe's most valuable automaker, valued at €85 bn
11.article_body: Porsche overtook parent company Volkswagen to become Europe's most valuable carmaker as its market valuation reached €85 billion. After falling below the listing price on Monday, Porsche's shares rose as investment banks bought 3.8 million shares for €312.8 million as part of the company's greenshoe option. Measures taken to stabilise Porsche's share price were seen as part of the IPO.

12.title: Zerodha's billionaire CEO shares his 5 healthy habits including 12 hrs of fasting
12.article_body: Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath shared five habits that made him healthier after a Twitter user asked for the same. "Dinner & killing all devices 2 hours before sleep. Yoga Nidra or some form of meditation for 10 minutes before sleep...12 hours of fasting at least," tweeted Kamath. "Setting daily activity goals on Apple Watch...Protein before a drink," he added.

13.title: Kuldeep Yadav sledges David Miller after he misses delivery, video goes viral
13.article_body: Team India Chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav sledged South Africa batter David Miller after the latter missed his delivery which turned sharply during the first ODI in Lucknow. Kuldeep was seen saying something to Miller following the delivery. The incident happened in the 24th over of South Africa's innings. Kuldeep registered figures of 8-0-39-1 in the match.

14.title: How to retweet it more than once: Shamsi on pic of ground dimensions used for 3rd T20I
14.article_body: South Africa spinner Tabraiz Shamsi retweeted a picture of ground dimensions used for third India-South Africa T20I in Indore. "Surely an international ground...should have bigger boundaries than 55 metres," the original tweet read. Shamsi wrote, "Does anyone know of a way which can allow me to retweet this more than once...Let's make cricket an even contest between bat and ball."

15.title: 2,500 positions in police department will be filled soon: Punjab CM
15.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said 2,500 positions in the police department will be filled soon. The new recruitments will include 1,156 constables (intelligence and investigation cadres), 787 head constables (investigation cadre) and 560 sub-inspectors (intelligence and investigation in district and armed police cadres). Mann said tests for the recruitments will be held later this month.

16.title: Will respond to Rahul Gandhi's letter on injured elephant: Bommai
16.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that he will respond to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's letter about an injured elephant calf at the Nagarahole Tiger Reserve, on humanitarian grounds. Rahul Gandhi wrote to Bommai, seeking intervention to provide timely treatment to the injured elephant calf. Bommai said he would speak to forest officials and ensure that treatment is given.

17.title: SEBI asks Brickwork Ratings to shut operations in 6 months
17.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) asked Brickwork Ratings to wind down operations within six months stating "failure to exercise proper skill, care and diligence, while discharging its duties as a credit rating agency". SEBI instructed the agency to not take on fresh clients or new mandates from now. Brickwork is one of seven SEBI-registered credit rating agencies.

18.title: 12 more bodies recovered from Uttarakhand's Draupadi ka Danda-2 peak
18.article_body: A total of 12 bodies of trainees were recovered from the Draupadi ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi on Thursday after an avalanche hit the mountain on Tuesday, said Nehru Institute of Mountaineering. With this, the total death toll of the incident has reached 16, including two instructors. Over 20 mountaineers are still believed to be missing.

19.title: For first 10 days in 'Chup', I kept thinking I'll get fired: Shreya
19.article_body: Actress Shreya Dhanwanthary revealed that she kept thinking that she will get fired from R Balki's 'Chup' for the first 10 days of the shoot. "I kept thinking that they will realise that they made a mistake, that I don't know anything and will let me go," she added. Shreya stated Balki had more faith in her than herself.

20.title: Vicky Kaushal's father posts 21-year-old photo of actor with Shah Rukh, pic goes viral
20.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal's father and action director Sham Kaushal has shared a 21-year-old photo of his sons, Vicky and Sunny, posing with Shah Rukh Khan on the sets of film 'Asoka'. Shershaah director Vishnu Vardhan, who worked as an assistant director in 'Asoka', is also seen in the photo. "Vicky was studying in 8th standard," Sham Kaushal wrote.

21.title: Raj woman strangles husband to death to get ₹50 lakh insurance, loan money
21.article_body: A 47-year-old woman in Rajasthan's Nagaur allegedly strangled her husband to death to claim an insurance amount and avail of a loan waiver of ₹50 lakh. The accused, Sharda, was reportedly also engaged in a property dispute with her husband over the last three years. Sharda and her husband engaged in an altercation on Tuesday, after which she strangled him.

22.title: 3 Hindu Munnani functionaries threaten beef stall worker in TN; arrested
22.article_body: Police have arrested three Hindu Munnani functionaries for threatening a beef stall employee in Tamil Nadu's Periyanaickenpalayam on Tuesday. The three functionaries, who were allegedly in an inebriated state, had threatened the employee against operating the stall. They were arrested based on a complaint by the stall's owner, who was not present at the stall when the incident happened.

23.title: Security arrangements made for Durga idol immersion in Hyderabad
23.article_body: Elaborate security arrangements have been made for immersion of Durga idols in Hyderabad, which will start on Thursday evening and continue till the early hours of Friday. Police expect around 6,000 idols to be immersed in the Hussain Sagar lake. Rapid Action Force (RAF) teams are deployed at MJ Market, Siddiamber Bazar, Charminar and Lal Darwaza to help local police.

24.title: Google Chrome is most vulnerable browser in 2022: Report
24.article_body: A new report by Atlas VPN has revealed that with 303 vulnerabilities in 2022, Google Chrome is the most vulnerable browser so far this year. It's also the all-time leader, with 3,159 cumulative vulnerabilities since its inception. It's followed by Mozilla Firefox, with 117 vulnerabilities, and Microsoft Edge, with 103 vulnerabilities. Apple's Safari browser documented 26 vulnerabilities in 2022.

25.title: ₹8.81 crore fine collected from traffic violators in Gurugram till August 2022
25.article_body: Gurugram Traffic Police said they have collected ₹8.81 crore as fines from around 8 lakh traffic violators between January and August this year. As per police, most of these challans have been issued for driving in the wrong direction, followed by for driving without high-security number plates, no entry, excess seating capacity, dangerous driving, using black films etc.

26.title: Women engage in fight, pull each other's hair in Thane local; video surfaces
26.article_body: An argument between two women on board Thane-Panvel local train turned violent after they started thrashing each other. A video of the incident that reportedly took place on Wednesday evening has surfaced on social media. The women are seen pulling each other's hair and raining slaps on each other in the video.

27.title: Any role that anybody gets is because Leo DiCaprio passed on it: Bale
27.article_body: Actor Christian Bale has said that any role that anybody gets is because Leonardo DiCaprio passed on it. "All those people that I've worked with multiple times, they all offered every one of those roles to him first," he added. Bale further stated, "So, thank you, Leo, because literally, he gets to choose everything he does."

28.title: 17-yr-old boy stabbed with a knife in Delhi after fight on Dussehra
28.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was stabbed to death after a fight with a group in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Wednesday during Dussehra celebrations. The deceased had gone to watch Ramlila when he got into a fight with a group of people. He collapsed in a pool of blood with the knife still stuck in his chest while the attackers escaped.

29.title: People visit Ujjain flyover for selfies before 'Mahakal Lok' opening
29.article_body: Ahead of the 'Mahakal Lok' opening, Ujjain's Hari Phatak Overbridge has turned into a 'selfie point' as everyday people can be seen gathering near the parapet and taking photos. "People of Ujjain are super excited about the new corridor," a resident of the city said. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the new corridor on October 11.

30.title: India urges New Zealand to be 'fairer' over student visa issue
30.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar interacted with his New Zealand counterpart Nanaia Mahuta on Thursday and raised the issue of visa delays being faced by Indian students. Some students had to leave New Zealand due to COVID-19 and couldn't get the opportunity to get their visas renewed. Jaishankar said he urged a fairer and more sympathetic treatment for these students.

31.title: Man stabbed to death at Hyderabad's Edi Bazaar
31.article_body: A man was stabbed to death by a group of people in Hyderabad's old city area on Tuesday. The victim, identified as Syed Baqtiyar Agha Qureshi, had come to meet some people near Anmol Hotel at Edi Bazaar where he was attacked with sharp-edged weapons and died on the spot. The police shifted the body to the Osmania Hospital mortuary.

32.title: Hawkers assault 52-yr-old woman on bridge of Thane railway station
32.article_body: A 52-year-old woman was assaulted on the bridge of Thane railway station after she had an altercation with some hawkers whose merchandise was displayed in a manner that was impeding the movement of people. "A group of hawkers hit her and also outraged her modesty," a railway police official said. The accused have been booked, he added.

33.title: Scores of flights cancelled in Germany as Eurowings' pilots go on strike
33.article_body: Scores of flights were cancelled in Germany on Thursday as pilots of domestic carrier Eurowings went on a strike. The pilots have demanded better pay and more rest hours between flights. By Thursday morning, more than 150 flights were cancelled across German cities. Around 30,000 passengers are expected to be affected by the strike.

34.title: Expression of interest invited for Future Retail's insolvency resolution process
34.article_body: The resolution professional of Future Retail (FRL) has invited 'expression of interest' from prospective buyers under the ongoing Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process. All interested and eligible prospective applicants (PRA) for FRL will have to submit an expression of interest for the resolution plan by October 20. The resolution professional will issue the final list of PRAs on November 6.

35.title: Rupee drops 32 paise to close at all-time low of 81.94 against US dollar
35.article_body: The Indian rupee declined by 32 paise to close at a record low of 81.94 against the US dollar on Thursday. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the local currency opened at 81.52 and witnessed an intra-day high of 81.51 against the American currency. Earlier, on Tuesday, the rupee appreciated by 20 paise to end at 81.62 against the dollar.

36.title: Acid-like chemical sprayed at girl in MP's Durga puja pandal; 10 arrested
36.article_body: A group of men reportedly sprayed an acid-like or inflammable chemical on a girl at a Durga puja pandal in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Tuesday. Police have arrested 10 persons in the case. While they are trying to ascertain the motive behind the attack, it's not clear if the girl was the actual target or not. She has been hospitalised.

37.title: China to increase coercion after Prez Xi assumes 3rd term: Taiwan
37.article_body: Taiwan's Minister of Mainland Affairs Council Chiu Tai-san on Thursday said Beijing will increase its coercion and intimidation tactics against the island after Chinese President Xi Jinping assumes a third term in office. China considers Taiwan as its own territory. Chiu said Beijing's work in relation to Taiwan has entered a phase of so-called 'anti-independence and promoting reunification'.

38.title: Ex-DC spinner Lamichhane arrested on landing in Nepal in 17-yr-old girl's rape case
38.article_body: Former Nepal captain and former Delhi Capitals spinner Sandeep Lamichhane was arrested immediately upon landing in Nepal's Kathmandu on Thursday in 17-year-old girl's rape case. In a video shared by Kantipur TV on Twitter, the 22-year-old can be seen being escorted in police custody. The 17-year-old girl had accused Lamichhane of raping her at a hotel in Kathmandu.

39.title: My role was mine: Mouni on if her role was better than Alia's in Brahmastra
39.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy was asked about her role being better than Alia Bhatt's in 'Brahmastra'. To this, she replied, "Why are you asking me such controversial questions? My role was mine. My responsibility was to play the antagonist...that's what I focussed on and that's what I did." Mouni played Junoon in the film, which also featured Ranbir Kapoor.

40.title: Very happy to have support of young people in the party: Shashi Tharoor
40.article_body: Talking about the party's Presidential Poll, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said he feels very happy to have the support of young people in the party. "I'm not turning away any support, be it young or old," he said. "We need everyone to join us in this adventure of making a rejuvenated Congress to lead young India," he added.

41.title: Pathankot residents paste posters of 'missing' MP Sunny Deol on houses, cars
41.article_body: Several posters of BJP's Gurdaspur MP Sunny Deol were pasted by people on walls of houses, vehicles and railway stations in Punjab's Pathankot which read "gumshuda ki talaash" (searching for a missing person). "After becoming [the] MP, [Deol hasn't] visited Gurdaspur. He...hasn't brought any industrial development [here]...If he doesn't want to work, he should [resign]," a protesting local said.

42.title: Investors get ₹7.6 lakh cr richer in 2 trading sessions as Sensex rallies
42.article_body: Investors' wealth rose by ₹7.6 lakh crore in two trading sessions as market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms rose to ₹275.9 lakh crore on Thursday. BSE Sensex, which rose over 1,400 points in the last two trading sessions, closed 156.63 points higher at 58,222.10 on Thursday. ICICI Bank, Infosys, ITC and Reliance were among the top contributors to Sensex's rise.

43.title: DCW seeks action-taken report over 11-yr-old's rape inside Delhi school
43.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) on Thursday sought an action-taken report from Delhi Police on alleged rape of an 11-year-old girl by two senior students inside a Delhi school's washroom in July. She had allegedly reported the matter to a teacher but school authorities didn't refer it to Delhi Police. DCW has sought details of arrests made by October 10.

44.title: Deepak Nirula of ice cream and fast food chain Nirula's passes away at 70
44.article_body: Deepak Nirula, the son of Madan Gopal Nirula, who made the fast food brand 'Nirula's' famous across north India, passed away at 70 on Tuesday. The family sold the brand name to Navis Capital Partners in 2006. "Thank you for giving us our first pizza, our first burger, our first ice-cream parlour experience," an Instagram post by Nirula's said.

45.title: Microsoft may invest $100 mn in Indian gaming firm Zupee: Report
45.article_body: Microsoft is in talks to invest over $100 million in Indian online gaming platform, Zupee, as per a report. The report added that the deal may not go through as Microsoft thinks that Zupee's pay-to-win service may be seen as gambling. If the deal goes through, Zupee will reportedly use Azure and other Microsoft cloud services.

46.title: My wife doesn't write as many love letters to me as you do: Kejriwal to Delhi L-G
46.article_body: Taking a jibe at Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that even his wife doesn't write as many love letters to him as he does. "My wife doesn't scold me as much as L-G sahib does every day," Kejriwal tweeted in Hindi. L-G sahib, chill a little, he further said.

47.title: 45-year-old female journalist dies in road mishap in Bengaluru
47.article_body: A 45-year-old female journalist died and her husband was injured after their scooter was hit by a truck on Bengaluru's Hebbal Flyover on Tuesday. The deceased journalist was identified as CR Latha, who worked for a Kannada news TV channel. The truck is reported to have grazed the scooter, following which Lata fell under the truck.

48.title: US-led military exercises provoked North Korea: Russia, China at the UN
48.article_body: Russia and China on Wednesday told the United Nations (UN) that military exercises led by the US had provoked North Korea into test firing missiles. The United Nations Security Council was debating on how to respond to North Korea which launched a ballistic missile over Japanese territory. The session ended without an agreement on what the next steps should be.

49.title: HC orders probe in linkage of sewage & stormwater drains in B'luru
49.article_body: The Karnataka High Court (HC) has ordered a probe to ascertain which agency allowed connecting an underground drainage system from a residential layout to a stormwater drain in Bengaluru Urban district. The investigation will be led by an officer of the rank of a Deputy Commissioner of Police or above. The court said adverse effects of this connection include waterlogging.

50.title: World Bank cuts India's growth forecast to 6.5% for 2022-23
50.article_body: The World Bank, in its twice-a-year report on South Asia, cut its growth forecast for India to 6.5% year-on-year for 2022-23, from earlier estimates of 7.5%. It further warned that the Russia-Ukraine war and global monetary tightening will affect the economy. "Private investment growth is likely to be dampened by heightened uncertainty and higher financing costs," the World Bank said.

51.title: Rain disrupts electricity supply in parts of Hyderabad
51.article_body: After heavy rains lashed Hyderabad on Thursday, electricity supply in various parts of the city was impacted. Telangana State Southern Power Distribution Company Limited took to Twitter to announce that power supply will be restored soon. Sriram Nagar, Srinagar Colony and Indira Nagar faced power cuts for nearly an hour. A yellow alert was issued by the IMD for Hyderabad.

52.title: Man arrested for smuggling ₹27-crore gold watch studded with diamonds at Delhi airport
52.article_body: The Delhi Customs have arrested an Indian national at IGI airport on his arrival from Dubai for allegedly smuggling seven luxury wrist watches, including one Jacob & Co watch made of gold and studded with diamonds worth ₹27 crore. Besides the watches, a diamond-studded gold bracelet and an iPhone 14 Pro 256 GB was also recovered from the passenger.

53.title: Crowd at Maha CM's rally showed which is real Shiv Sena: Fadnavis
53.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that the "huge" crowd at CM Eknath Shinde's Dussehra rally in Mumbai showed who leads the real Shiv Sena. "There was a huge gathering at the BKC ground whose capacity is the double of that of Shivaji Park (where Uddhav Thackeray spoke), and the BKC ground was filled to the brim," Fadnavis said.

54.title: Cong's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will have no impact: K'taka CM Bommai
54.article_body: The Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which is currently passing through Karnataka, "will have no impact", CM Basavaraj Bommai said on Thursday. "Naturally all party leaders will work for their own party, she (Sonia Gandhi)...walked for half-a-kilometer and gone, it's okay," Bommai said. He rejected claims that BJP was planning state-wide tours of its leaders to counter the Congress' yatra.

55.title: BJP MP Pragya Thakur appears before court in Malegaon blast case
55.article_body: BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur, a prime accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, appeared before a Mumbai trial court on Thursday. Her lawyer cross-examined an official of the Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad who had arrested her. Thakur, who initially sat on the wooden bench assigned for the accused, was allowed to sit on a chair after she complained of backache.

56.title: 19-yr-old held for stabbing sanitation employee to death in Thane
56.article_body: A 19-year-old man, Monish Dilip Jadhav, was arrested for stabbing a 40-year-old sanitation employee of Bhiwandi Nizampur City Municipal Corporation (BNCMC) to death at her house in Thane, police said. The accused was the neighbour of the deceased Savita Shivram Salve and was robbing her house when he was caught red-handed. Jadhav then stabbed her and escaped from the house.

57.title: Work on flyover at Pune University junction may start next week
57.article_body: The Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) has planned to start the work on the multi-level flyover at the Pune University junction next week. Earlier, the PMRDA had declared that the work on the flyover will start in September and later said that it would start on Friday. However, it again postponed it on PMC's request due to traffic issues.

58.title: Ranbir wants me to get back to work soon after baby's birth: Alia Bhatt
58.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has revealed that her husband and actor Ranbir Kapoor wants her to go back to work soon after their baby's birth. "He...said in an interview...'I have this very big responsibility...to send Alia back to work because the fans would really complain...hold me responsible if I don't do my bit as a parent as well'," she stated.

59.title: My 1st pay cheque was ₹7,000 when I had no bank account: Sidharth Malhotra
59.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra revealed his first pay cheque was for ₹7,000 and added that he had no bank account when he received the cheque. Speaking about his acting aspirations as a child, Sidharth said that his family never took him seriously. "It was...in my late teens I started facing still cameras and all and then that whole thing," he added.

60.title: India, Indonesia debt outperforms China despite global selloff
60.article_body: According to reports, the sovereign debt of India and Indonesia lost 0.4% and 1.5% respectively for dollar-based investors in the third quarter, less than other emerging Asian markets including China. The Rupiah and the Rupee have the widest spreads in emerging Asia, offering investors relief from global market volatility. China hasn’t seen the scale of foreign inflows observed last year.

61.title: Ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav on 'life-saving' drugs: Medanta Hospital
61.article_body: Gurugram's Medanta Hospital on Thursday claimed that former UP CM and Samajwadi Party leader Mulayam Singh Yadav is on "life-saving" drugs. "He is being treated in the ICU by a comprehensive team of specialists," the hospital said. Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday reached the hospital to enquire about Yadav's health.

62.title: India will do whatever it can for Ukraine crisis' solution: EAM
62.article_body: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar on Thursday said that India is willing to do whatever it can to facilitate a solution to the Ukraine crisis. He said it is natural that different countries and different regions would react a little differently when it comes to Ukraine. Jaishankar said this during his interaction with Auckland Business Chamber's CEO Simon Bridges.

63.title: SEBI may start criminal prosecution of market offenders: Report
63.article_body: The central government in consultation with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) is looking to allow the market regulator to initiate criminal prosecution of market offenders, according to a report. Presently, SEBI can not prosecute offenders and can only initiate proceedings against them in any court of the country. It can, however, pass penalty orders against these offenders.

64.title: Not selling anything in India: Indian firm behind syrups linked to 66 deaths in Gambia
64.article_body: Indian cough syrup manufacturer Maiden Pharmaceuticals is "not selling anything in India", the company's director Naresh Kumar Goyal told Reuters. He added that the company is trying to find out from its buyer in Gambia details related to the deaths of 66 children which the WHO said may have been linked to its products.

65.title: 26-yr-old man arrested with 'Meow Meow' drug worth ₹1 lakh in Pune
65.article_body: Pune Police's Anti-Narcotic Cell arrested a 26-year-old man with 6.9 grams of mephedrone or 'Meow Meow' drug worth ₹1 lakh. "We're looking at...supply chain and distribution network of the suspect," a police officer said. "Primary probe suggests...he used to buy the contraband from a dealer in Mumbai and had been selling it in Pune in small packets," he added.

66.title: Alia Bhatt shares pictures with Ranbir Kapoor from her baby shower
66.article_body: Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to share pictures with actor-husband Ranbir Kapoor from her baby shower. "Just...love," she wrote in the caption of the post. Two of the pictures show the Bhatt and the Kapoor families while another picture shows Alia with some of her friends, including Akansha Ranjan Kapoor. The baby shower was held at Alia and Ranbir's home.

67.title: He should apologise to nation: Anil Vij over Udit Raj's remark on Prez
67.article_body: Reacting to Congress leader Udit Raj's "chamchagiri" remark on President Droupadi Murmu, Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij said that Raj should apologise to the nation for his statement. "Udit Raj's statement is shameful. Droupadi Murmu has become President after winning the election," Vij said. "He is insulting the democratic system, he is insulting a tribal woman," he added.

68.title: CCI must fairly address global mergers and acquisition issues: FM Sitharaman
68.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the Competition Commission of India must "fairly and squarely" address issues arising out of cross-country mergers and acquisitions. She added that CCI should pay attention to Indian law and its evolution keeping fair trade and competition in mind. "It should also be cognisant of what is developing in different parts of the world," she said.

69.title: Walked half-a-km and gone: K’taka CM on Sonia Gandhi joining Bharat Jodo Yatra
69.article_body: After Congress chief Sonia Gandhi joined party's Bharat Jodo Yatra on Thursday in Karnataka, CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "She has walked for half-a-km and gone." Speaking about the yatra, he said, "Naturally, all party leaders will work for their own party...As far as we're concerned, we have nothing to do with it and it doesn't make any impact."

70.title: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel gets environmental clearance for Hazira plant expansion
70.article_body: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India announced it has received environment clearance for expansion of its plant in Hazira to 15 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) from the current crude steel capacity of 9 MTPA. The company said government's National Steel Policy would receive a big boost from the project. The venture will also help the company's own long-term capacity expansion ambitions.

71.title: SEBI nod for IPOs worth ₹5,000 crore to expire this month
71.article_body: Approvals given by SEBI for IPOs worth ₹5,000 crore are set to lapse in October as four firms have delayed the issue launch amid tough market conditions.  The companies are One Mobikwik Systems, Skanray Technologies, Penna Cement Industries, and ESAF Small Finance Bank. According to experts, Paytm owner One97 Communications' disappointing listing was another reason for the delay.

72.title: 3 killed as car skids off, falls 50 feet down in Uttarakhand’s Bageshwar
72.article_body: A car skidded off a road and fell 50 feet down in Uttarakhand's Bageshwar on Thursday, leading to the death of three people. Police said one person, who was injured in the accident, has been admitted to the hospital. The four people were on their way back home after a Ramleela show when the driver lost control over the car.

73.title: 'Citadel' India set in 90s, series to go on floors by Nov end: Report
73.article_body: The Indian version of 'Citadel', starring Varun Dhawan and Samantha Ruth Prabhu, is reportedly set in the 1990s and will go on floors by the end of November or early December. Varun and Samantha will reportedly start their workshops for the Raj and DK directorial series by early November. It's expected to premiere by the second half of 2023.

74.title: 3 SP leaders write to Akhilesh, seek to donate kidney to Mulayam Singh
74.article_body: Three Samajwadi Party (SP) Councillors from Bareilly have written a letter to party chief Akhilesh Yadav expressing their will to donate a kidney to Mulayam Singh Yadav. The 82-year-old MP is in the ICU of Gurugram's Medanta hospital. Gaurav Saxena, Shamim Ahmed and Raees Mian Abbasi said donating a kidney to him would be a matter of pride for them.

75.title: Vintage cars on display to promote wildlife protection in B'luru
75.article_body: To create awareness about wildlife week, the Karnataka Forest Department called vintage car and motorcycle owners to promote the idea of preserving things from the past in Bengaluru. The vehicle owners held a rally at the Vidhana Soudha. Wildlife week is observed from October 2 to October 8 to create awareness among people about the importance of wildlife protection.

76.title: Mountaineering, trekking banned in Uttarkashi till Oct 8 over bad weather alert
76.article_body: Uttarkashi District Magistrate Abhishek Ruhela has said that trekking and mountaineering activities have been banned in Uttarkashi district from October 6-8. His decision came after the meteorological department issued an alert for rain and snowfall in the region. Recently, 10 trainee mountaineers were killed in an avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarkashi.

77.title: Scooby-Doo's Velma is a lesbian, confirms new Halloween movie
77.article_body: Scooby-Doo's Velma Dinkley has been confirmed as a lesbian in 'Trick or Treat Scooby-Doo!'. It shows Velma's character having a crush on Coco Diablo, a new character who plays the head of a costume crime syndicate. To mark the moment, Google has added a feature in which pride flags and confetti appear if one searches for any Velma-related term.

78.title: New Vande Bharat Express hits herd of buffaloes, front part of engine damaged; pic surfaces
78.article_body: The recently inaugurated Vande Bharat Express running between Mumbai Central and Gandhinagar met with an accident on Thursday, after a herd of buffloes came on the tracks. The incident occurred between Vatva station to Maninagar in Gujarat. The accident damaged the front part of the engine, said Western Railway Senior PRO JK Jayant.

79.title: There was no Hindu religion during Rajaraja Cholan's period: Kamal Haasan
79.article_body: Speaking about 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', Kamal Haasan has said that there was no such thing as "Hindu religion" during the reign of Rajaraja Cholan. "There was Vainavam, Shivam and Samanam...the Britishers gave us that name (Hindu) as they didn't know how to refer to us collectively," he added. Recently, filmmaker Vetrimaaran objected to portraying Rajaraja Cholan as a Hindu king.

80.title: Shami is somebody the opposition do fear: Steyn on Bumrah's replacement
80.article_body: Ex-South Africa pacer Dale Steyn has said he has written down Mohammad Shami's name as Jasprit Bumrah's replacement for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "As [Bumrah's] replacement, I'd look at someone who can qualify with similar experience. Shami is probably the guy I would go with," stated Steyn. "Shami's somebody the opposition do fear," he added.

81.title: BJP's fall in next poll begins: Jairam during Bharat Jodo Yatra in K'taka
81.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Thursday, during the Congress' ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra in Karnataka, said, "The response we have garnered from a BJP-ruled state in Karnataka shows that the countdown for BJP's fall in the next election has begun." Congress chief Sonia Gandhi also joined the yatra today in Karnataka. The Karnataka leg of the march began on Friday.

82.title: BEST to begin premium bus service by mid-October in Mumbai
82.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) is set to launch a premium bus service by mid-October to reduce the number of cars on city roads. "The premium bus service will run with 100 buses in the fleet till December," Lokesh Chandra, General Manager of BEST, said. Users will be able to book their tickets through Chalo app, he added.

83.title: Nobel Prize in Literature awarded to French author Annie Ernaux
83.article_body: The 2022 Nobel Prize in Literature has been awarded to French author Annie Ernaux. She has been given the award "for the courage and clinical acuity with which she uncovers the roots, estrangements and collective restraints of personal memory", a tweet read. Her writing "examines a life marked by strong disparities regarding gender, language and class", said Nobel Prize's website.

84.title: 3 kids die, 11 hospitalised after eating at children's home in Tamil Nadu
84.article_body: At least three children died and 11 others were hospitalised due to suspected food poisoning after they consumed food at a children's home in Tamil Nadu's Tiruppur. Following dinner on Wednesday, some children vomited while others had dysentery. Their condition deteriorated after they had breakfast on Thursday. The deceased, who died without responding to treatment, were aged between 10-13 years.

85.title: I almost joined McKinsey before starting Bhanzu: World's fastest human calculator
85.article_body: Neelakantha Bhanu Prakash, the 22-year-old known as the world's fastest human calculator, almost joined McKinsey before starting his math learning startup Bhanzu. "I started out at IIIT Hyderabad...dropped out...went to Delhi's St Stephen's College and started teaching and doing stage shows at the age of 17," he said. Founded in 2020, Bhanzu investors include CRED's Kunal Shah and comedian Biswa.

86.title: Lloyd's of London detects 'unusual activity', probes possible cyberattack
86.article_body: Insurance company Lloyd's of London has said it is investigating a possible cyberattack after the firm detected "an unusual activity on its network". "As a precautionary measure, we are resetting the Lloyd's network and systems. All external connectivity has been turned off, including Lloyd's delegated authority platforms," a spokesperson said. Around 100 insurance syndicates operate at Lloyd's.

87.title: Pay ₹10 lakh to kins of men who died inside sewer: Delhi HC to DDA
87.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed Delhi Development Authority (DDA) to pay ₹10 lakh each to the families of two men who died after inhaling toxic gases inside a sewer in Mundka area last month. "It is very unfortunate that even after 75 years of independence, poor people are being forced to work as manual scavengers," the High Court observed.

88.title: RTI activist injured, son killed by man accused of illegal mining in Guj
88.article_body: A man, accused of illegal mining, allegedly rammed his car into the scooter of a Dalit RTI activist who was with his 23-year-old son in Gujarat's Kutch on Monday, police said. The activist was seriously injured and his son succumbed to his injuries, police added. The activist had filed complaints of illegal mining against the man around a year ago.

89.title: 1,300 kg marijuana seized from 2 drug peddlers in Hyderabad, held
89.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested two interstate drug peddlers and seized 1,300 kg marijuana from them. Along with the contraband, the police also seized a vehicle and two mobile phones, all worth ₹2.80 crore, they stated in a press release. The accused regularly transported marijuana from Andhra Pradesh's East Godavari district to Telangana, Madhya Pradesh and other states, police stated.

90.title: Pak don't have a no. 4, fans leave stadium once openers get out: Ex-player Aaqib
90.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed has said their current side doesn't have a batter like Virat Kohli in their middle order and that's why they should experiment by bringing captain Babar Azam at number four position. "They don't have any player for number four...You are completely dependent on the openers. If they get dismissed, fans leave the stadium," added Aaqib.

91.title: Samsung's Q3 profit may fall by 25%, the first in 3 years: Report
91.article_body: Samsung Electronics' third-quarter profit could reportedly decline by 25%, the first year-on-year fall in nearly three years, according to a Refinitiv SmartEstimate. This could be driven by a fall in demand for electronic devices and the chips that power them due to rising inflation. Samsung's operating profit has likely fallen to 11.8 trillion won ($8.3 billion) in the July-September quarter,

92.title: Agritech startup FALCA raises $3 mn in Pre-Series A funding round
92.article_body: Agritech startup FALCA has secured more than $3 million in a Pre-Series A funding round led by Inflection Point Ventures. The funding round also saw participation of LetsVenture, Mumbai Angels, along with other high-net-worth individuals. The startup was founded in 2018 by Santosh Danegoudar. The company said that it is currently working with 1,00,000 farmers.

93.title: Suspected of being child lifters, 3 ‘sadhus’ beaten in Chhattisgarh
93.article_body: A mob beat up three men dressed like 'sadhus' in Chhattisgarh's Durg district on Wednesday, said police. The people suspected them to be child thieves after they were seen speaking to some children at a Dussehra fair, said police. The victims, who hailed from Rajasthan, sustained minor injuries and were treated at a local hospital.

94.title: Driver was distracted as he was plugging charger: Police on Mumbai accident that killed 5
94.article_body: The accused in Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link accident, identified as Irfan Abdul Raheem Beelkia, has been arrested by the police. The interrogation of the accused revealed he was trying to plug in his mobile phone charger and lost sight of the road ahead, police said. A total of five persons were killed and eight others were injured in the accident.

95.title: Pics of liquor bottles surface after CM Shinde’s Dussehra rally in Mumbai
95.article_body: Yuva Sena, the youth wing of Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, shared pictures of liquor bottles and garbage, a day after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's Dussehra rally. The pictures are of Mumbai University's Kalina campus, which provided the parking facility for the event. Yuva Sena workers shared images of liquor bottles, thrown-away food and have demanded action against the organisers.

96.title: Local trains hit due to snag at Mumbai's Sandhurst Road station
96.article_body: Suburban train services were disrupted on Thursday due to a technical snag in overhead wires at south Mumbai's Sandhurst Road station. The snag, which occurred at about 1:00 pm, resulted in trains heading towards Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus being held up. Affected services have been diverted to the fast line and restoration work is in full swing, Central Railway said.

97.title: Electronics Mart India's IPO subscribed 6 times on day 2
97.article_body: Electronics Mart India's initial public offering (IPO) was subscribed six times on Thursday, the second day of bidding, as the participants bought 37.42 crore equity shares against the offer size of 6.25 crore shares. Retail investors subscribed 6.98 times, while non-institutional investors bought 8.08 times the portion. Qualified institutional buyers subscribed 2.67 times the reserved portion.

98.title: Shameful: NCW chief on Cong leader's 'chamchagiri' remark on Prez
98.article_body: National Commission for Women (NCW) Chairperson Rekha Sharma has criticised Congress leader Udit Raj after he said, "No country should get President like Droupadi Murmu. Chamchagiri also has its limits." "[Raj's] statement is not just against a woman but a constitutional head of government," the NCW chief said. "Comments made are condemnable. The derogatory language used is shameful," she added.

99.title: Solomon Islands won't be used by foreign military: Sogavare to Aus PM
99.article_body: Solomon Islands PM Manasseh Sogavare met his Australian counterpart Anthony Albanese in Canberra. "Solomon Islands will not do anything that will undermine our national security...will never be used for foreign military installations," Sogavare reportedly said. A joint statement issued by Albanese's office said the two leaders discussed bilateral ties, climate change and aspirations for Pacific.

100.title: SpiceJet shares jump 9% after report of ₹1,000 crore government loan
100.article_body: Shares of SpiceJet jumped by 9% on Thursday following reports of the airline likely receiving an additional loan of ₹1,000 crore under the government's modified Emergency Credit Line Guarantee Scheme. According to reports, the funds will help the airline clear its dues and induct new Boeing 737 Max planes. SpiceJet is currently operating less than 50% of its approved flights.

101.title: 19-year-old traces bike, catches thieves in 90 minutes in Navi Mumbai
101.article_body: A 19-year-old boy, along with his cousin, traced his stolen bike and caught the thieves within 90 minutes in Navi Mumbai. After the boy found his bike missing, he rushed to nearby petrol pump, assuming the thieves must have gone there as the bike didn't have enough petrol. When they reached there, they saw the thieves leaving and caught them.

102.title: I would love to see Umran Malik unleashed in Australia: Brett Lee
102.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee has said India's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik and Australia's 23-year-old all-rounder Cameron Green should've been part of their respective teams for the upcoming 2022 T20 WC. "I'd love to see Umran unleashed in Australia...[and] I can't fathom how Cameron isn't in [Australia's] team," he stated. Umran picked 22 wickets in his 14 games in IPL 2022.

103.title: Akasa Air to allow pets on board, bookings to begin from Oct 15
103.article_body: Newly launched airline Akasa Air said passengers can carry pets on board from November, the bookings for which will begin from October 15. One pet per person with weight of up to 7 kgs will be allowed, and domesticated cats and dogs have to be in a cage to board the flight. The pricing for this has not been disclosed.

104.title: Struggled between life, death for 3hrs: U'khand avalanche survivor
104.article_body: Deep Thakur, an Uttarakhand avalanche survivor recounted the experience after being rescued from Draupadi's Danda Peak in Uttarkashi. Thakur said the avalanche came suddenly, following which he and his companions fell into the crevasses about 60 feet deep and struggled between death and life for about three hours. Deep was among the 41 mountaineers who were stuck in the avalanche.

105.title: Gold prices in India surge to highest level in nearly 2 months
105.article_body: Gold rates on Thursday were the highest since August 16 as the Indian benchmark indices rose amid subdued dollar and Treasury yields. On the Multi Commodity Exchange, gold prices were up by 0.51%, touching ₹51,910 per 10 grams around 10:20 am. Gold prices also rose globally. Spot gold was up 0.4% at $1,722.09 per ounce in the initial trade.

106.title: Seen very few marriages work, would like to disprove that: Ali Fazal
106.article_body: Actor Ali Fazal said he's seen "very few marriages work" in his life, which is something he'd like to "disprove" in his relationship with Richa Chadha. The actor, who recently got married to Richa, said he shares "something spiritual" with the actress. "I thank her for that because she's made me more spiritually aware than I was before," he said.

107.title: Pune Zilla Parishad sets up 'inspection unit' to monitor public works
107.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad has set up a Development and Scheme Inspection Unit to monitor the implementation of public works and welfare schemes. "The unit will have six staffers...With the help of Pune ZP's software system that allows contractors to fill up daily updates on work progress, it will monitor the progress of all public works," an official said.

108.title: 12,000 Meta employees may lose jobs amid 'quiet layoffs': Report
108.article_body: Meta, formerly Facebook, is undergoing "quiet layoffs" that could affect 15% or around 12,000 employees of the company's workforce, Insider reported citing several employees. Meta's executives reportedly told directors across the company to select at least 15% of their team to be labelled as "needs support". These employees will be put on a performance improvement plan and eventually let go.

109.title: Mumbai man sentenced to 10-year jail for raping minor daughter for 7 years
109.article_body: A man in Mumbai was sentenced to ten years in jail for raping his minor daughter for seven years. The accused worked on a ship in Saudi Arabia and visited his family every two months. In 2014, his wife noticed that their daughter avoided him and the girl told her that she was sexually assaulted by her father many times.

110.title: Mumbai's Charni Road's old foot-over bridge to be shut for 45 days
110.article_body: The old foot-over bridge (FOB) of Charni Road station of Mumbai Suburban Railway will be closed for 45 days till November 18 owing to construction work, according to Western Railway. The FOB will be closed for constructing a link connecting the newly constructed foot over-bridge and platforms 2 and 3. Both spans of the existing FOB will be dismantled.

111.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st ODI against South Africa
111.article_body: India captain Shikhar Dhawan won the toss and elected to bowl first in the first ODI against South Africa. The match has been reduced to 40 overs per side contest due to rain delay. Batter Ruturaj Gaikwad and leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi are making their ODI debut for India. India's playing XI also includes Sanju Samson, Ishan Kishan and Kuldeep Yadav.

112.title: Mumbai reports more than 100 COVID-19 cases for 2nd straight day
112.article_body: According to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, Mumbai reported 127 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, taking the overall tally to 11,50,828. This comes a day after the city recorded 155 COVID-19 cases. No fresh death due to the infection was recorded on Wednesday, while 116 patients recovered in the last 24 hours. The number of active COVID-19 cases in Mumbai is 795.

113.title: Twitter to now let users post tweets with different media formats
113.article_body: Twitter is rolling out a new feature that lets users combine three media formats (GIFs, photos, videos) in a single tweet on both Android and iOS devices. "This feature will roll out globally...with a chance to see mixed media Tweets on the web," Twitter said. Users can also rearrange their media's layout while composing a tweet, it added.

114.title: Roblox enabled a girl's sexual and financial exploitation: Lawsuit
114.article_body: A lawsuit has accused Roblox of enabling a girl's sexual and financial exploitation by adult men in US' California. The lawsuit claims that the victim came in contact with adult men through Roblox, who encouraged her to use Discord, Snapchat and Instagram. They then exploited her by encouraging her to abuse prescription drugs and send sexually explicit photos of herself.

115.title: 16-kg heroin worth ₹80 crore seized at Mumbai airport, flyer arrested
115.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested an airline passenger with drugs at Mumbai airport following a tip-off on Wednesday. The DRI seized 16 kg of heroin valued at more than ₹80 crore from his luggage. The accused, who is a resident of Kerala, revealed that a foreign national had given him $1,000 as commission to take him to India.

116.title: Shocking incident: Thai PM as 34 people killed in shooting at daycare
116.article_body: Thailand PM Prayut Chan-o-cha called the mass shooting at a daycare centre on Thursday that killed at least 34 people, including 22 children, a "shocking incident". The PM has ordered all agencies to urgently treat the wounded. The gunman was a former police officer and he reportedly took his own life following the shooting in Nong Bua Lamphu province.

117.title: WhatsApp's Beta update blocks screenshots of 'View Once' messages
117.article_body: In its latest Android Beta update, WhatsApp has introduced a feature that enables blocking screenshots and screen recordings of 'View Once' messages. CEO Mark Zuckerberg said, "'View once' is already...popular way to share photos...that don't need to have a permanent digital record. Now WhatsApp is enabling screenshot blocking for 'View Once' messages for an added layer of protection."

118.title: Cong stoops to new low: BJP leader over Udit Raj's 'chamchagiri' remark on Prez
118.article_body: BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla criticised Congress leader Udit Raj over the latter's "chamchagiri" remark on President Droupadi Murmu. "Ajoy Kumar called President Droupadi Murmu as evil and then Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury used the term 'Rashtrapatni', now Congress stoops to a new low!" Poonawalla tweeted. "Udit Raj uses unacceptable language for the first woman Adivasi President," he added.

119.title: 2 arrested for stealing phones worth ₹70 lakh from Hyd Bajaj store
119.article_body: The Rachakonda Police has arrested two persons who allegedly stole as many as 432 cellphones worth ₹70 lakh from a Bajaj Electronics store in Hyderabad in September. Police found three persons wearing face masks entering the store in CCTV footage. The main accused was arrested from Jharkhand's Sahibganj district, while another from West Bengal.

120.title: Batters are to be blamed: Pak Women captain Maroof after defeat vs Thailand
120.article_body: After suffering their first-ever defeat against Thailand in women's T20I history, Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof said their batters are to be blamed for the loss in their Asia Cup match. "Our batters [didn't show] intent...130+ could've been a good total and as a captain, I'm disappointed," added Maroof. Thailand restricted Pakistan to 116/5 and won the match by four wickets.

121.title: 'Ekk Deewana Tha' was mistake, shouldn't have done it: Director
121.article_body: Filmmaker Gautham Vasudev Menon, who directed 'Ekk Deewana Tha', said the 2012 film was a mistake. The film was a remake of the Tamil film 'Vinnaithaandi Varuvaayaa'. Gautham stated the original film was "naturally organic film". Speaking about making a remake of it, he said, "I shouldn't have done that...Somebody asked me 'Did you direct 'Ekk Deewana Tha'?'...I said no."

122.title: UAPA invoked against 15 PFI activists arrested during NIA raids in B'luru
122.article_body: Bengaluru City Police invoked the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) against 15 Popular Front of India (PFI) activists. The accused were arrested on September 22 following raids by the National Investigation Agency (NIA). "UAPA has been invoked in the case against the accused on account of the involvement of a few in crimes in the past," police said.

123.title: 4 men hit 3 policemen with car, beat them with rods in Gurugram hospital
123.article_body: Three police personnel were injured after a group of four men attacked them in a private hospital in Gurugram, officials said on Wednesday. The accused tried to hit them with their car and later beat them with sticks and iron rods, police said. Police reached the hospital after a brawl broke out when the accused refused to pay for medicines.

124.title: 11-yr-old gets trapped inside lift in Gr Noida, rescued after 45 mins
124.article_body: An 11-year-old boy got trapped inside a lift in Greater Noida's Paramount Emotions society for almost 45 minutes before he was rescued by his parents. CCTV footage of the kid playing inside the lift went viral on social media, in which the boy can be seen pushing the lift buttons and inserting a bottle in between the lift doors.

125.title: I'm sitting with my grandfather & talking about periods, it's progress: Navya
125.article_body: Navya Naveli Nanda said it's a sign of progress as she discussed menstruation on a public forum in the presence of her grandfather Amitabh Bachchan. "It's a sign of life...That's not something...we should be ashamed of, or shy away from," she stated. "Menstruation has been a taboo for a long time, but there has been progress," said Navya.

126.title: Wife expressing desire to work after marriage isn't cruelty: Bombay HC
126.article_body: The Bombay High Court has ruled that if a wife expresses a desire to go to work after marriage, it would not amount to cruelty. The HC said this while dismissing a man's plea for divorce on grounds of cruelty. "The marital life should be accessed as a whole and few isolated instances....will not amount to cruelty," the court added.

127.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
127.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs till October 10. Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Meghalaya may witness it across the next four days. It is very likely over Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi and Maharashtra on October 8 and 9. Gujarat may witness it from October 8 to 10.

128.title: US believes Ukrainians behind killing of Russian nationalist's daughter: Report
128.article_body: United States intelligence agencies believe that parts of Ukrainian government were behind a car bomb attack that killed Darya Dugina, daughter of Russian President Vladimir Putin's ally, Alexander Dugin, the New York Times reported. It mentioned that US took no part in the attack and was not aware of it. Russia had accused Ukraine's secret service of orchestrating the attack.

129.title: Gujarat govt launches scheme to attract ₹12.5 trillion investments
129.article_body: Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel unveiled a scheme for attracting investment of ₹12.50 trillion and creating at least 15 lakh jobs in the next five years under Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Schemes for Assistance to Industries. Patel said that the scheme is aimed at encouraging youth to innovate and become job creators as well as de-risking their investments through incentives.

130.title: Rahul kneels down to tie Sonia Gandhi's shoelaces during Bharat Jodo Yatra, pic viral
130.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi joined the Karnataka leg of the Bharat Jodo Yatra on Thursday. Congress MP Shashi Tharoor shared a photo on Twitter showing Rahul Gandhi kneeling next to his mother Sonia Gandhi to tie her shoelaces during the yatra in Karnataka. Tharoor wrote, "Even if she breathes, it also has prayers, Mothers do not break, mothers are mothers!"

131.title: Thailand defeat Pak in a women's T20I for 1st time ever, celebration video goes viral
131.article_body: Thailand defeated Pakistan by four wickets in the league stage of Women's Asia Cup T20 2022 on Thursday. With this, they registered their first-ever victory against Pakistan in women's T20I cricket history. Thailand restricted Pakistan for 116/5 and chased down the target in 19.5 overs. A video of their celebration has gone viral on social media.

132.title: Bihar man detained after threat to 'blow up' Antilia, kill Ambanis
132.article_body: Mumbai Police have detained a man from Bihar in connection with threat calls to Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani's family. On Wednesday, two calls were received at Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital in Mumbai, threatening to blow up the hospital and Ambani's residence Antilia. The caller also threatened to kill Mukesh Ambani, Nita Ambani, Akash Ambani & Anant Ambani.

133.title: World's currency reserves shrink by a record $1 trillion this year
133.article_body: The global foreign-currency reserves have declined by about $1 trillion, or 7.8%, this year to $12 trillion, the biggest drop since Bloomberg began keeping a record in 2003. The decline comes amid the central banks of India and the Czech Republic's intervention to support their own currencies. India's reserves have slumped by $96 billion this year to $538 billion.

134.title: Persistent Systems gains after JPMorgan upgrades stock to 'overweight'
134.article_body: After brokerage house JPMorgan upgraded the call on shares of Persistent Systems Limited to 'overweight' from 'neutral', its stock gained on Thursday. JPMorgan gave a revised target price of ₹4,100 apiece. The Pune-headquartered company is JPMorgan's only 'overweight' within the Engineering, Research and Development space. At 1:52 pm, its shares were trading 6.81% higher at ₹3,522 on the BSE.

135.title: Man's Apple Watch overheats, makes crackling sounds and then explodes
135.article_body: An Apple Watch Series 7 overheated, made "crackling sounds" and then "exploded" just as he was throwing it out the window, its owner claimed in a statement in 9to5Mac. The device's owner visited the emergency room because of lead poisoning concerns. Apple arranged a pickup for the affected device, saying it would take the device to its lab for investigation.

136.title: Pic of gunman who killed 34 people including 22 kids at Thailand daycare released
136.article_body: Thailand's Central Investigation Bureau has released a picture of the gunman, an ex-police officer, who killed 34 people including 22 kids at a daycare centre. Media reported that the gunman later shot and killed himself. Mass shootings are rare in Thailand even though the rate of gun ownership is high compared with some other countries in the region.

137.title: Poland says it's in talks to host US nuclear weapons amid Russia threat
137.article_body: Poland has spoken to the US about having NATO's nuclear weapons on its territory, Polish President Andrzej Duda said amid growing fears that Russian President Vladimir Putin could resort to using nuclear arms in Ukraine. However, deploying US nuclear weapons to Poland, a neighbour of Ukraine, could be a violation of NATO's Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty and the NATO-Russia Founding Act.

138.title: Prithvi Shaw's name should've been there for SA ODIs: Aakash Chopra
138.article_body: Reacting to Prithvi Shaw's omission from the three-match ODI series against South Africa, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said the 22-year-old's name should have been there in the squad. "I frankly see Shaw playing in the next T20 World Cup...Management should start inducting him and utilising him. His numbers are fantastic in domestic cricket," stated Aakash.

139.title: Virgin Atlantic halts London to Hong Kong flights after nearly 30 years
139.article_body: British airline Virgin Atlantic has decided to suspend Heathrow to Hong Kong service, shut its Hong Kong office after nearly 30 years of operation due to prolonged closure of Russian airspace. "Significant operational complexities due to the ongoing Russian airspace closure have contributed to the commercial decision not to resume flights in March 2023," airline founder Richard Branson said.

140.title: Won't allow screening of 'Adipurush': BJP spokesperson Ram Kadam
140.article_body: BJP spokesperson Ram Kadam has said that the screening of 'Adipurush' won't be allowed as it has "distorted the Hindu gods and goddesses". "Some film producers to earn publicity and money have this habit of distorting facts, but the Hindu society will not tolerate such things," he said. Previously, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra also raised objections against 'Adipurush'.

141.title: Australia proposes changes in privacy policy after Optus data breach
141.article_body: Australian government has proposed changes in consumer privacy rules after a data breach at the country's second-largest mobile operator, Optus, compromised personal details of almost 10 million customers. The amendment will let telcos share government-issued identification data with banks for enhanced monitoring for affected users. Banks will have to destroy data when it is no longer required.

142.title: India's services sector growth hit 6-month low in September: PMI
142.article_body: India's services sector activity fell to a six-month low in September at 54.3, the S&P Global India Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) showed. "September also saw a broad stabilisation of input cost inflation...slowest upturn in prices charged for the provision of services since March," Economics Associate Director Pollyanna De Lima noted. In August, PMI stood at 57.2.

143.title: Reflects their anti-tribal mindset: Sambit Patra on Cong leader's remark on Prez
143.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra criticised Congress leader Udit Raj over the latter's "chamchagiri" remark for President Droupadi Murmu. "Words used for President Murmu by Congress leader…[are] worrisome, unfortunate," Patra said. "This isn't the first time they have used such words. Congress' Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury did it too. This reflects their anti-tribal mindset," he added.

144.title: 11-yr-old girl watching garba dies in MP, CT scan shows bullet in head
144.article_body: An 11-year-old girl collapsed and started bleeding profusely while watching garba in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Tuesday, said police. She was taken to a hospital where she died. According to the victim's father, the doctor suggested a CT scan, which showed a bullet-like metallic object in her skull. Based on the post-mortem report, police said a bullet had hit her.

145.title: 31 people including kids killed in mass shooting at daycare centre in Thailand
145.article_body: At least 31 people including kids have been killed in a mass shooting at a pre-school daycare centre in Thailand, police said. Police added that the attacker, an ex-police officer, shot and stabbed children and adults and is now on the run. Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha has alerted all agencies to take action and apprehend the culprit, a spokesperson said.

146.title: Fix for wheel issue that caused electric car recall found: Toyota
146.article_body: Toyota Motor said it has found a fix for the defect because of which it had to recall several units of its first electric vehicle in June. The carmaker recalled 2,700 bZ4X sports utility crossovers globally due to a risk of wheels coming loose. Toyota said it would ensure hub bolts were replaced and properly tightened in new cars.

147.title: Cong leader Udit Raj clarifies 'chamchagiri' remark on Prez, calls it his personal view
147.article_body: Congress leader Udit Raj on Thursday said his remarks on President Droupadi Murmu accusing her of "chamchagiri" were personal and didn't represent his party's views. "My statement...is mine & [has] nothing to do with Congress," part of his tweet read. He had earlier accused her of "chamchagiri" after she said "the salt produced in Gujarat is consumed by all Indians".

148.title: 'Bhoot Police' likely to get a sequel, confirms Saif Ali Khan
148.article_body: Saif Ali Khan has confirmed that the makers of 'Bhoot Police' are "very keen to do a sequel". The film, which had a direct-to-OTT release in 2021, starred Saif with Arjun Kapoor, Jacqueline Fernandez and Yami Gautam. "I liked my role in Bhoot Police. It continues to be one of the most watched films on that [OTT] platform," Saif said.

149.title: Gujarat youth slashes girl's face after asking if she had an affair
149.article_body: A youth allegedly slashed a 14-year-old girl's face in Gujarat's Surat after asking if she had an affair with someone. Although the girl replied in negative, he attacked her with a knife. The victim had to undergo surgery and got 17 stitches. According to the victim's mother, the accused had been harassing her daughter for the past three months.

150.title: Sydney records wettest year since records began in 1858
150.article_body: Australia's Sydney has recorded its wettest year since records first began in 1858. Sydney has received about 2,213 mm of rainfall since January, surpassing the previous record of 2,194 mm set in 1950, official data showed. In the past two years, floods have struck Sydney's suburbs three times, forcing tens of thousands of people to flee their homes.

151.title: 66 clinics halted abortions in 15 US states after Roe vs Wade overturned: Report
151.article_body: At least 66 clinics in 15 US states have stopped providing abortions since the country's Supreme Court overturned Roe vs Wade that guaranteed abortion rights to American women, according to the Guttmacher Institute. The number of clinics providing abortions in the 15 states dropped from 79 before June to 13 as of October, all of which are in Georgia.

152.title: Fan breaks down on meeting Dwayne Johnson, actor shares video
152.article_body: Dwayne Johnson shared a video in which a fan couldn't hold back his tears on meeting the Hollywood actor and former wrestler. The video shows Dwayne signing a WWE Championship belt for the fan. "Even my cold, dark soul gets a little emotional when I see people start to break and cry," the actor wrote along with the video.

153.title: Vijay Nair sent to judicial custody till Oct 20 in Delhi liquor policy case
153.article_body: Delhi's Rouse Avenue court has sent the former CEO of event management firm Only Much Louder (OML), Vijay Nair, to judicial custody till October 20 in a Delhi liquor policy case. He was arrested for his alleged role in the irregularities pertaining to the excise policy. Notably, Nair is the communications in-charge of the Aam Aadmi Party.

154.title: We will not rely on others for defence: Taiwan Prez
154.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Wednesday said that Taiwan will not rely on others for its defence. "Taiwan is fully committed to protecting our security...We're also working to adapt our defence strategy to the changing threats we face," she added. China claims democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory and has vowed to take the island by force if necessary.

155.title: No country should get Prez like Murmu, 'chamchagiri' has its limits: Cong leader
155.article_body: Congress' Udit Raj said "no country should get President like Droupadi Murmu". "Chamchagiri also has its limits. She says 70% of people eat Gujarat's salt. If you live life by eating salt yourself, you'll know," he tweeted. Earlier, President said Gujarat produces 76% of country's salt and it can be said "salt produced in state is consumed by all Indians".

156.title: Rahkeem Cornwall smashes 205* off 77 balls, including 22 sixes, in 20-over match in US
156.article_body: West Indian all-rounder Rahkeem Cornwall smashed an unbeaten 205 off 77 deliveries, including 22 sixes and 17 fours, while representing Atlanta Fire against Square Drive in an Atlanta Open 2022 match. His knock helped his team post a total of 326/1 in their 20 overs. Atlanta Fire went on to win the match by 172 runs.

157.title: India's tallest flag, higher than Pak flag, to be installed at Wagah-Attari border
157.article_body: The country's tallest flag at 418 feet is set to be installed at the Wagah-Attari border by the National Highways Authority of India, an official said. The present 360-feet high flag was installed in March 2017, following which Pakistan had hoisted a taller flag at Wagah check post. The new Tricolour will be 18 feet longer than the Pakistani flag.

158.title: SpaceX launches 52 Starlink satellites hours after launching Crew-5 mission
158.article_body: SpaceX launched 52 Starlink satellites seven hours after launching members of the Crew-5 mission to the space station on Wednesday. The satellites lifted off atop a Falcon 9 rocket from California's Vandenberg Space Force Base. They were deployed about 62 minutes after liftoff. SpaceX now plans to launch the Intelsat G-33/G-34 mission on October 6.

159.title: Harish Kalyan announces engagement to Narmada Udayakumar, shares pics
159.article_body: Tamil actor Harish Kalyan took to his social media accounts to introduce his fiancee Narmada Udayakumar. Announcing his engagement with Narmada, Harish shared that the two will soon tie the knot. "As we embark on a new life journey to explore and reinvent ourselves together, we seek double the blessings and love from you all, now and always," he wrote.

160.title: Apollo, Sixth Street end talks to finance Musk's Twitter deal: Report
160.article_body: Apollo Global Management and Sixth Street have ended talks with Tesla's Elon Musk to finance his Twitter deal, Reuters reported citing sources. Apollo had been looking at ways to support the deal earlier, while Sixth Street investors were looking at providing about $1 billion. Musk has once again proposed to buy Twitter after backing out of a $44-billion deal earlier.

161.title: Former Uber security chief guilty of concealing 2016 data breach
161.article_body: Former Uber security chief Joseph Sullivan has been found guilty of criminal obstruction by a San Francisco jury for concealing a data breach in 2016 from the FTC. Sullivan "worked to hide" the breach from FTC and "took steps to prevent the hackers from being caught", Attorney Stephanie Hinds said. The breach exposed data of 57 million passengers and drivers.

162.title: BMC gives ₹10 cr each to 24 wards for beautification, repair projects
162.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has disbursed ₹10 crore each to all the 24 municipal wards for beautification and repair projects. "BMC has earmarked a total fund of ₹30.5 crore for each ward for carrying out the beautification and repair work on priority. It has disbursed ₹10 crore to complete the pending work, mainly micro-level, at the earliest," an official said.

163.title: Ban 'Adipurush', Lord Ram wrongly depicted in the film: Ayodhya Ram Temple head priest
163.article_body: The head priest of the Ayodhya Ram Temple on Wednesday demanded an immediate ban on the movie 'Adipurush', over the alleged wrong depiction of Lord Ram, Hanuman and Ravana. Making a film is not a crime but they should not be made to create deliberate controversies to hog the limelight, chief priest Satyendra Das said.

164.title: World's oldest dog passes away aged 22
164.article_body: World's oldest dog, Pebbles, passed away from natural causes at her home in Taylors, South Carolina, US with her owners Bobby and Julie Gregory by her side, Guinness World Records said. The Toy Fox Terrier was born on March 28, 2000, in Long Island, New York. Pebbles birthed 32 puppies across three different litters with her late partner, Rocky.

165.title: I see Deepak Chahar being Bumrah's replacement at the T20 WC: Jaffer
165.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said he sees pacer Deepak Chahar being Jasprit Bumrah's replacement for Team India in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "Deepak is getting to play and he is going to play again in the ODIs and it makes sense...He is a quality new-ball bowler, and I do not think he lacks variation," stated Jaffer.

166.title: Tejashwi reaches Medanta Hospital to check on Mulayam Singh's health
166.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday reached Gurugram’s Medanta Hospital to enquire about former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav's health. "There is some improvement in his health. He is in CCU. Met with Akhilesh Yadav and gave him my best wishes," Tejashwi Yadav said. Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar also visited the hospital yesterday to check on Singh's health.

167.title: Ramayan inspires people to protect all living beings: UP CM Yogi
167.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said the Ramayan inspires people to protect all living beings, as the CM fed milk to a leopard cub at Gorakhpur’s Shaheed Ashfaq Ullah Khan Zoological Park. Speaking on the occasion, CM Yogi said human beings will be safe only when they are aware of their responsibilities towards the nature and conservation of animals.

168.title: 2 electrocuted to death in Durga Puja pandal in UP's Barabanki
168.article_body: Two people, including a 17-year-old boy, were electrocuted to death in a Durga Puja pandal in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki on Wednesday, said police. Several other people also received electric shocks. The incident occurred after a wire supplying electricity to the pandal was damaged, according to a villager. The bodies have been sent for post-mortem.

169.title: JSW Energy gains after Maharashtra MoU for hydro pumped storage project
169.article_body: After JSW Energy's wholly-owned subsidiary JSW Neo Energy entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with Maharashtra to set up a hydro pumped storage project (PSP) in the state, JSW Energy stock surged on Thursday. It will set up a 960 MW capacity hydro PSP. At 11:45 am, the company's stock was trading 11.85% higher at ₹328 apiece on the NSE.

170.title: Girl raped, murdered in UP's Mainpuri
170.article_body: A girl was allegedly raped and murdered in the Nagla Shisham village of Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri district, police said on Wednesday. The victim's younger sister saw the body hanging in the house through the window after returning from coaching. She said a person named Pushpendra strangled her sister to death. Their parents were away at the time of the incident.

171.title: Myanmar jails Japanese filmmaker for 10 years for violating laws
171.article_body: A court in military-ruled Myanmar has jailed a 26-year-old Japanese documentary filmmaker, Toru Kubota, for 10 years over violation of sedition and telecommunications laws, a Japanese Foreign Ministry official said. Kubota was arrested in July at a protest in Myanmar's Yangon. A court hearing on allegations of violation of the immigration control law will be held on October 12.

172.title: 26-year-old man arrested with mephedrone worth ₹1.04 lakh in Pune
172.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a 26-year-old man, who works at the shop of a cloth trader, with 6.9 grams of banned drug mephedrone worth ₹1.04 lakh. This comes after police received a tip-off that a man was trying to sell mephedrone in the Dhankawadi area. "We are looking at the supply chain and distribution network of the suspect," police said.

173.title: Sushmita Sen shares pic showing her look as transgender activist Gauri Sawant
173.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen has announced her next web series, 'Taali', where she will play transgender activist Gauri Sawant.
