346.article_body: CG Power and Industrial Solutions' former Chairman Gautam Thapar and three other entities were imposed a five-year ban and fine by the Securities and Exchange Board of India for diversion of funds and misrepresentation of the company's financial statements earlier. SEBI also penalised a total of 11 entities, including KN Neelkant, Atul Gulatee, Aditya Birla Finance Limited and IndusInd Bank.

347.title: H'yana CM reaches Medanta Hospital to check on Mulayam Singh's health
347.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Wednesday reached Medanta Hospital in Gurugram to check on the health of former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav admitted there. "Met with [his] family, his son Akhilesh Yadav. Wishing for his quick recovery. Doctors say there is an improvement, but full recovery will take time," Khattar said.

348.title: Adani Enterprises announces 2 new subsidiaries
348.article_body: Adani Enterprises has announced the creation of a wholly-owned subsidiary Adani Disruptive Ventures (ADVL) along with another subsidiary Alwar Alluvial Resources (AARL), a stock exchanges filing said. Jeet Adani, Vice President of group finance for the Adani Group is a part of the core team of ADVL. Alwar Alluvial Resources will be engaged in the manufacturing and processing of minerals.

349.title: HDFC Bank reports 23.5% jump in loans in Q2, highest in over 3 yrs
349.article_body: HDFC Bank reported a 23.5% year-on-year surge in loan advancements to ₹14.8 lakh crore in the September quarter. This is its highest loan growth in more than three years or 14 quarters. Advances grew 25.8% from last year, including inter-bank participation certificates and rediscounted bills. Deposits for the September quarter increased 19% to ₹16.73 lakh crore.

350.title: Our Laughter Challenge companion Parag Kansara has passed away: Sunil Pal
350.article_body: Comedian Sunil Pal took to social media to share a video wherein he revealed that comedian Parag Kansara has passed away. "Our Laughter Challenge companion Parag is no more...I've no idea what's happening to the comedy world...Just few days ago...we had lost Raju Srivastava." Parag was one of the six contestants in first season of The Great Indian Laughter Challenge.

351.title: Who are the only 5 people to win the Nobel Prize twice?
351.article_body: American chemist Karl Barry Sharpless, who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry on Wednesday, and in 2001, is the fifth individual to be awarded two Nobel Prizes. Besides him, Nobel Prize laureates John Bardeen, Marie Skłodowska-Curie, Linus Pauling and Frederick Sanger have won two Nobel Prizes each. Curie became the first person to receive two Nobel Prizes in 1911.

352.title: India's stand on Ukraine-Russia war shows we're being heard: Bhagwat
352.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that India's stand during the Ukraine-Russia conflict showed the country was being heard. "We're becoming more and more self-reliant on the national security front as well," he said. "Bharat's importance and stature have increased in the community of nations. In the sphere of security, we are becoming more and more self-sufficient," he added.

353.title: Hyderabad Police bust red sanders smuggling gang, 500 kg wood seized
353.article_body: The Hyderabad Commissioner's Task Force along with Forest Department officials busted an interstate red sanders smuggling gang and seized 500 kg wood worth ₹75 lakh from them, police said. Four persons were arrested and one accused is currently absconding. The main accused, Shaik Abdullah, reportedly incurred losses in real estate and decided to smuggle red sanders, police stated.

354.title: Indian Oil, BPCL plan oil deals before sanctions on Russian crude: Report
354.article_body: State-owned refiners are looking to lock-in more of their crude supplies in term deals amid concerns over tighter Western sanctions, including from the EU on Russian crude, Reuters reported. Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum are seeking term deals with countries, including the US. "We're preparing for a backup...world is uncertain because of Russia-Ukraine conflict," an official said.

355.title: 46% CEOs globally planning job cuts, 39% freeze hiring: KPMG report
355.article_body: With signs that the Great Resignation could be cooling down, 39% of CEOs have implemented a hiring freeze and 46% are considering downsizing their workforce over the next six months, according to the eighth edition of KPMG 2022 CEO Outlook. The report also mentioned that three-year view is more optimistic with only 9% CEOs are expecting a further reduced headcount.

356.title: India's Suryakumar Yadav became world number one T20I batter for 2 days, shows ICC's data
356.article_body: As per ICC's data, India batter Suryakumar Yadav became world number one T20I batter for two days. He achieved top rank with 854 rating points after overtaking Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan on October 2 and remained on top position on October 3 as well. However, he slipped to second position after scoring 8(6) against South Africa in third T20I on Tuesday.

357.title: Uber asks employees to work from office twice a week from Nov 1
357.article_body: Uber has asked employees to work from the office twice a week. It announced Tuesdays and Thursdays as "anchor days", wherein all non-remote employees must work from the office globally, starting November 1. Earlier, Uber allowed staff to work from anywhere as much as half the time, but now they can work remotely for up to four weeks per year.

358.title: WI going to be struggling for a long time: Ex-WI player Winston Benjamin
358.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Winston Benjamin has criticised their current management, stating that they don't even have the "quality" to be picking a side that would compete at the international level. "We are going to be struggling for a long time," he added. Earlier in August, WI lost two T20I series at home, first against India and then against New Zealand.

359.title: Elections to be held in J&K after voters’ list compilation: Shah
359.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday said elections will be held in J&K with "full transparency" as soon as work of compiling the voters’ list is completed. Furthermore, he said manner in which delimitation has been done in the region, representatives of the people’s choice will be elected. The Union Home Minister was addressing a public rally in Baramulla.

360.title: Credit Suisse's Deputy Head of wealth management in Asia resigns
360.article_body: The Deputy Head of Credit Suisse's Asia-Pacific wealth management business Young Jin Yee has resigned. This development comes at a time when the shares of Switzerland's second-biggest bank touched a new record low after declining 12% on October 3 to 3.52 Swiss francs ($3.7). The bank has lost about 60% of its market value this year.

361.title: Chiranjeevi says he wasn't satisfied with 'Lucifer', Mohanlal fans react
361.article_body: At GodFather's pre-release event, Chiranjeevi said he "wasn't completely satisfied with 'Lucifer'". The statement received reactions from Mohanlal fans. A fan tweeted, "'Lucifer' movie is classic, nobody can come near it," while another fan called the statement "really unprofessional and arrogant". Meanwhile, Chiranjeevi fans are calling 'GodFather' his "great comeback" after Acharya's failure.

362.title: Congress, NCP to support Uddhav's candidate in Andheri East bypoll
362.article_body: Congress and NCP extended support to former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction's candidate in the bypoll for Andheri East Assembly seat. Congress' Nana Patole said his party firmly stands with Shiv Sena and will not field any candidate. The bypoll was necessitated after Shiv Sena MLA Ramesh Latke's death. Shiv Sena has decided to field Latke's wife Rutuja.

363.title: Traffic diversions issued in Hyd for Durga idol immersion on Oct 6
363.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police have issued a traffic advisory for immersion of Durga idols in Hussain Sagar lake on Thursday, October 6. Traffic will be diverted at NTR Marg and People's Plaza on Necklace Road from 4 pm till the immersion concludes. Traffic coming from Ambedkar statue will not be allowed towards NTR Marg and will be diverted towards Iqbal Minar.

364.title: MCD signs deal with Lajpat Nagar traders’ body over sanitation of market roads
364.article_body: MCD has signed an agreement with the Traders Association Lajpat Nagar, where the traders' body will take care of sanitation and sweeping services of six-kilometre roads in and around the marketplace. Cleaning of roads will be done using a mechanised machine, which will reduce the dust factor from the roads, Traders Association Lajpat Nagar (TALN) General Secretary Ashwani Marwah said.

365.title: Russian TV journalist who protested invasion says she escaped house arrest
365.article_body: Russian TV journalist Marina Ovsyannikova, who staged an on-air protest against the Russian invasion of Ukraine, confirmed she had escaped house arrest. Ovsyannikova was put under a two-month house arrest in August over a protest in which she called Russian President Vladimir Putin a murderer. "I refuse to comply with...restraint imposed on me...and release myself from it," she said.

366.title: Violence against Muslims is treated as justice in PM's new India: Owaisi
366.article_body: Criticising the Centre over the violence in Gujarat's Kheda during Navratri celebrations, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that "every day there is more evidence of mass radicalisation". "Floggings and mob violence by police have become common. Targeted violence against Muslims is treated as 'justice'. This is the reality of Modi's Vishwaguru/New India/5G/$5 Trillion Ton economy," Owaisi said.

367.title: Delhi woman cheats 25 people of over ₹1 cr in kitty scheme; arrested
367.article_body: Delhi Police has arrested a 52-year-old woman, a resident of Delhi's Dwarka, for allegedly cheating her neighbours of over ₹1 crore by running a kitty. She cheated over 25 people by inducing them to invest money and promising to return matured amount within 15 months. She shifted to an unknown place after the maturity period passed.

368.title: I make the money, my mother Soni Razdan handles it: Alia Bhatt
368.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that her relationship with money is that she makes it and her mother Soni Razdan handles it. "I'm not sure how much money I have in the bank...I do sit with my team and have an idea...I know my mother is handling it very well," she added. Alia recently featured in Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra'.

369.title: If Shami is to replace Bumrah, then he should've played Asia Cup: Aakash
369.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has criticised the Indian management over Mohammad Shami's omission from recent tours and the 2022 Asia Cup. "Jasprit Bumrah missed the tour to West Indies and Asia Cup...and if Shami [is] indeed the best option to replace Bumrah...then he should have been a part of the Asia Cup at the very least," wrote Aakash on Twitter.

370.title: No call for ransom yet: Relative of Indian-origin family abducted in US
370.article_body: There has been no call for ransom till now, said a relative of the Indian-origin family that was abducted in US' California on Monday. "[The family's] car was found burnt 20-25 kilometres away from their office. Their mobile phones have been found," the relative, who lives in Punjab's Hoshiarpur, said. US authorities have reportedly released a potential suspect's photo.

371.title: Pune civic body starts drive to confiscate properties of tax defaulters
371.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has started a drive to confiscate properties of tax defaulters. "In the past few days, we've confiscated properties of 21 citizens who failed to pay their tax. Of these 21, 12 defaulters came forward and have so far paid ₹93 lakh in arrears," an official said. PCMC has decided to seize over 1,300 properties in total.

372.title: Ukraine forces approach borders of Luhansk Oblast that Russia annexed: UK
372.article_body: UK has said Ukrainian soldiers have advanced up to 20 km beyond the Oskil river in northeastern Kharkiv towards Luhansk Oblast. "Russian leaders will...be concerned that leading Ukrainian units are approaching the borders of Luhansk Oblast, which Russia claimed to have annexed," UK Defence Ministry said. Russia formally annexed four regions of Ukraine on Wednesday.

373.title: White.Inc raises $1 mn in round led by Dholakia Ventures, others
373.article_body: White.Inc﻿ has raised $1 million in funding led by Dholakia Ventures, which also saw the participation of Inflection Point Ventures and FirstPort. Other participants in the round included angel investors Suhail Sameer and Shashvat Nakrani from BharatPe, Gunavanth Vaid from 4G Capital Ventures and Aniket Gore from Ceramet Group. White.Inc was founded by Siddharth Gadodia and Young Yun in 2021.

374.title: Previous govts laid stones, forgot completing projects after polls: PM in Himachal
374.article_body: After inaugurating AIIMS Bilaspur in Himachal Pradesh, PM Narendra Modi, while addressing a rally, said development in Himachal Pradesh is possible as people have voted BJP to power. "Previous governments used to lay stones and forget about completing projects after polls, but our government lays stones and inaugurates projects," PM Modi added.

375.title: No talks with Pakistan; Modi govt won't tolerate terrorism: Shah
375.article_body: Addressing a rally in Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday, Union Home Minister Amit Shah ruled out holding any dialogue with Pakistan. He said, "Some people say we should talk to Pakistan. Why should we talk to Pakistan? We will not talk. We will talk to the people of...Kashmir." He added that PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government does not tolerate terrorism.

376.title: 45 Indians trapped in fake job rackets in Myanmar rescued: MEA
376.article_body: India on Wednesday said that it has rescued around 45 Indians trapped in fake job rackets in Myanmar. The information was shared by the spokesperson of the Ministry of External Affairs, Arindam Bagchi. More Indians have been rescued and are in the custody of Myanmar authorities, Bagchi said, adding that legal formalities for their repatriation have begun.

377.title: Civilian killed in accidental firing, policeman arrested: J&K Police
377.article_body: A 25-year-old civilian, Asif Ahmad, was killed after a policeman's service rifle went off at a checkpoint in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Wednesday, said police. SHO Zafar Ahmad said it was a misfire. The victim was rushed to a hospital where he succumbed. The policeman was arrested and his weapon was seized, said police.

378.title: Protesting teachers climb atop water tank in Punjab, threaten self-immolation
378.article_body: Demanding jobs as physical training instructors (PTI) in government schools for a year now, two teachers climbed a water tank in Mohali protesting against the Punjab government and threatened self-immolation. AAP government is giving false assurance to us, said one of the protesting teachers. Last year, five teachers staged a similar protest by climbing atop a water tank in Mohali.

379.title: Former Haryana MLA Anil Dhantori quits Congress
379.article_body: Anil Dhantori, a former MLA from Shahbad assembly segment of Haryana's Kurukshetra district, left Congress on Tuesday. In his resignation letter, Dhantori said that he is resigning from the party's primary membership and from the post of National Media Panelist (Spokesperson) of Congress. Sharing the letter on Twitter, Dhantori wrote, "Farewell Congress." He represented Shahbad from 2009 to 2014.

380.title: Congress loses chair of Parliamentary panels on IT, Home
380.article_body: Congress leaders have been removed as heads of parliamentary standing committees on Home Affairs and Information Technology. Thiruvananthapuram MP Shashi Tharoor, who headed the IT committee, has been replaced by Prataprao Jadhav, a Shiv Sena MP from the Eknath Shinde faction. Congress MP Abhishek Manu Singhvi has been replaced by BJP MP Brij Lal as Home Affairs committee chairman.

381.title: Michael Bevan picks 3 teams as favourites to win 2022 T20 World Cup
381.article_body: Ex-Australia batter Michael Bevan has picked India, England and Australia as his favourites to win the 2022 T20 World Cup. Bevan, however, added, "Given the home ground advantage (for Australia), it should help [them] a little bit." Notably, India recently defeated Australia 2-1 in their three-match T20I series. Australia had won the 2021 T20 WC after defeating New Zealand.

382.title: Co-founder & strategy head of bankrupt crypto firm Celsius steps down
382.article_body: Bankrupt cryptocurrency lending firm Celsius' Co-founder and Chief Strategy Officer, S Daniel Leon has stepped down, the company said on Tuesday. The announcement comes a week after the company's CEO Alex Mashinsky resigned from his position. In July, Celsius had filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, a month after pausing withdrawals, citing extreme market conditions.

383.title: Bertozzi, Meldal, Sharpless win Chemistry Nobel for click chemistry, get ₹7.45-cr prize
383.article_body: The 2022 Nobel Prize in Chemistry has been awarded to Carolyn R Bertozzi, Morten Meldal and K Barry Sharpless. They have been awarded the prize for the "development of click chemistry and bioorthogonal chemistry". For their Nobel win, they will get 10 million Swedish kronor (₹7.45 crore) prize money.

384.title: Woman traces snatcher using smartwatch in Gurugram, gets phone back after hitting him
384.article_body: A woman in Gurugram, using her smartwatch, tracked a man for about three hours and took back her mobile that he had snatched from her in a market. She told the police that he snatched her phone while she was performing a UPI transaction. When she spotted him, she hit him on his head and later approached the police.

385.title: IT Minister drops made-in-India smartphone to test its strength
385.article_body: Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, who attended the recently-concluded digital technology forum India Mobile Congress (IMC), intentionally dropped a made-in-India smartphone to test its strength. In a video of the event's highlights shared by the minister, he was seen dropping the phone to the ground. IMC, the largest digital technology forum in Asia, was held from October 1-4 in Delhi.

386.title: Unknown caller issues life threats to Mukesh, Nita Ambani; Mumbai Police probes
386.article_body: An unknown person called on the landline number of Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital in Mumbai on Wednesday and issued life threats to Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani. The caller also issued threats to Nita Ambani, Akash Ambani and Anant Ambani and threatened to blow up the hospital. "Investigation in this matter is being done," Mumbai Police said.

387.title: 3 arrested after viral video shows them beating a dog in B'luru
387.article_body: Three men were arrested in Bengaluru after a purported video of them beating a dog went viral on social media. The three men thrashed the dog with wooden canes for barking at them the previous day, reports said. The dog's owner, who filmed the incident, was pushed by the accused when he tried to intervene.

388.title: Default electricity subsidy extended in Delhi, to continue till Oct 31
388.article_body: Delhi government has extended the default electricity subsidy by one more month, till October 31. Now, consumers who failed to opt-in for the subsidy till September 30, will get free electricity up to 200 units and 50% subsidy on the consumption of below 400 units in October also. From November, only those who opt for it will get the subsidy.

389.title: If Raavan's from Lanka, he shouldn't look like Mughals: Dipika on 'Adipurush'
389.article_body: Actress Dipika Chikhlia, who played Sita in the show 'Ramayan', opened up about Saif Ali Khan's look as Raavan in 'Adipurush'. "A film's characters must appeal to the audience. If the character is from Sri Lanka, they should not look like Mughals," she stated. 'Adipurush' was trolled on Twitter over its VFX and Saif's look after the teaser was released.

390.title: PM's governance model brings employment, Gupkar model offers guns: Shah in J&K
390.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing a public rally in J&K's Baramulla on Wednesday, said that PM Narendra Modi's model of governance brings development and employment. "The Gupkar model offers stones and guns in hands of the youth," Shah added. "There is a lot of difference between [PM] Modi's model and Gupkar model," Shah stated.

391.title: Over 200 fall sick In Gurugram society, water contamination suspected
391.article_body: Over 200 residents of a housing society in Gurugram's Sector 72 have fallen sick in the past two days with vomiting and diarrhoea, prompting the health department to look into complaints of suspected water contamination. The concerned officials said that they have collected water samples for examination and a report will be out soon.

392.title: Emerson to sell part of assets to Blackstone for up to $10 bn: Report
392.article_body: Emerson Electric is in talks with US buyout firm Blackstone to sell a part of its commercial and residential solution business assets, Bloomberg reported. The deal's value could be between $5 billion-$10 billion and would depend on the assets Emerson decides to sell. This comes after Emerson announced an $11-billion merger of its software units with Aspen Technology last year.

393.title: 30-year-old motorcyclist killed by 3 men in road rage in Ahmedabad
393.article_body: Three men allegedly killed a 30-year-old motorcyclist in a case of road rage in Ahmedabad. The incident took place on Monday after the three men going on a motorcycle asked the other motorcyclist to stop for nearly hitting their bike. Inspector YJ Rathod of Meghaninagar police said all three men are aged between 20 and 25 years.

394.title: CCTV footage shows dog carrying human skull in Navi Mumbai; probe on
394.article_body: A human skull was found near a company premises in Mahape, Navi Mumbai, on Tuesday. CCTV footage in the premises showed a dog carrying the skull three days ago. Rabale MIDC Police said the skull was completely burnt. They've launched an investigation to ascertain whether a body has been dumped anywhere or the dog brought the skull from a crematorium.

395.title: No charge for using RuPay credit card for UPI transactions up to ₹2,000: NPCI
395.article_body: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) on Tuesday said there'll be no charges on use of RuPay credit cards on the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) for transactions worth up to ₹2,000. As per an NPCI circular, UPI apps would ensure complete transparency on transactions using a credit card. The step has been taken to encourage wider acceptance of RuPay cards.

396.title: When you leave Mannat, SRK opens the car door for you: Riteish Deshmukh
396.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh has said that the most special thing about a get-together in Shah Rukh Khan's residence Mannat is its host. "Whenever you are leaving, SRK would come with you to your car and open the door of the car for you," he added. Riteish further revealed that dinner in such get-togethers is served at 3 AM.

397.title: Andhra doctor requests India to save his pet jaguar and panther from Ukraine
397.article_body: An orthopaedic doctor from Andhra Pradesh, who was based in Ukraine when the war with Russia broke out, has appealed to Indian government to help rescue his pet jaguar and panther. Dr Gidikumar Patil was forced to leave them behind with a local farmer when he left Ukraine for Poland. Dr Patil said he gets depressed thinking about the cats.

398.title: Wanted to become journalist, was huge Barkha Dutt fan: Hina Khan
398.article_body: Hina Khan said she "wanted to become a journalist" and was a huge Barkha Dutt fan, but "destiny had some other plans". She revealed that her friends "kind of forced" her to audition for 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai'. "I got selected in the first round, then they asked me to come to Bombay... and I started shooting," she said.

399.title: Russian Prez Putin signs bills to formally annex 4 regions of Ukraine
399.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday completed the formal annexation of more than 15% of Ukraine. Putin has signed bills admitting the Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia regions into Russia. Earlier, the annexation legislation was unanimously passed by both houses of the Russian Parliament. The formalities followed after referendums were held in the four regions amidst the war.

400.title: Makers wanted Sridevi to do an item song: 'English Vinglish' director
400.article_body: 'English Vinglish' director Gauri Shinde shared that the producers she initially approached for the 2012 film wanted Sridevi to do an item song. "I said I would rather put the film aside and not make it. Then Balki (R Balki, filmmaker-husband) decided to produce it ourselves," she said, adding that 'English Vinglish' was "the toughest thing" to be made.
